roleset.name: make conversation, conversing, talking
roleset.note: CONVERSE-V NOTES: Frame by Claire (from converse.01-v)
CONVERSATION-N NOTES: converse.01. corresponds to VNcls chit_chat-37.6. (from conversation.01-n)
CONVERSANT-J NOTES: Based on medical adjectives. Comparison with converse.01-v. Framed by Katie. (from conversant.02-j)

example.name: Without Subject
example.text: The false cypresses, which-1 *-1 had conversed with the clouds for a million years, were identified * as top-grade timber, and were thus condemned * to an inexorable fate.

example.name: Converse in a language
example.text: ...he-1 is capable of *-1 conversing fluently in either Beijing dialect or the southern Fujian dialect used * in Taiwan.
example.arg: in either Beijing dialect or the souther Fujian dialectused * in Taiwan

example.name: All args
example.text: Josephine's conversation with Napoleon about the quality of the prune danishes was interrupted by a raging mob of squirrels.
example.arg: about the quality of the prune danishes

example.name: Use manner for language
example.text: The doctor had a conversation in German about the fine he was going to have to pay on the spot.
example.arg: about the fine he was going to have to pay on the spot

example.name: another with language
example.text: I was engrossed in a french conversation about Sarkozy, Dominique StraussKahn.

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: Patient is conversant with me following stroke.

roleset.name: familiar with
roleset.note: CONVERSANT-J NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. No comparison. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from conversant.01-j)

example.name: both args
example.text: He was conversant with Spanish history.
